mobs.LongDesc: The Tarrasque is destroying everything in sight.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The dreaded tarrasque is the most fearsome creature native to the
Prime Marterial plane. It's a scaly biped two horns on it's head, a 
lashing tail, and a reflective carapace. The tarrasque is a killing machine,
active for only a small fraction of it's existance. When active, it destroys
everything for miles around, both plants and animals (and stray armies).
It is believed (and hoped) that the tarrasque is a unique creature, and
that there will never be another. No one is sure where it originated, but
it's rumored that it has destroyed one entire civilization. The records
of those people's last days tell of "a great reptilian punisher sent by
the gods to end the world."
   Might I suggest fleeing for your life?

mobs.LongDesc: A woman dressed in a glowing white gown of magic floats before you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Mystra: Greater Power of Nirvana
  Mystra is the most powerful of all the gods of Toril. She reigns as
supreme ruler of all magic on a world that is dominated magic. She is
also one of two gods that was granted immortality after the Time of 
Troubles. In her mortal life she retrieved the Tablets of Fate, which then
allowed the gods to regain their rightful positions in the heavens, after
the overgod Ao had cast them out. She has knowledge of every spell
ever cast by any mage or cleric throughout all of history, and can cast
any of them at will. Her power is so great that she is not permitted to
retain it all herself, and thus stores much of it in her Chosen. If not for
this precaution, she would easily be a match for the overgod himself.

mobs.LongDesc: A demonic madman cackles at you gleefully.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Cyric: Greater Power of Hades
  Cyric is one of two gods that had formerly been mortals. His role as
the traitor who stole the Tablets of Fate to return them to Ao earned
him a spot in the pantheon, replacing 3 evil gods, fallen during the Time
of Troubles: Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal. Having three gods' power has
made Cyric one of the most powerful of the gods. His portfolio of powers
includes being god of: death, murder, the dead, strife, tyranny, and
lies. He is the mortal enemy of Mystra, and she in return has deprived
him of magic. Without illusions to cover his hideousness, he appears
with red, cracked skin, rippling muscles with veins showing through the
skin, wild hair, and fingers that taper into claws. Cyric's everpresent
companion is the sentient and powerful sword, Godsbane, which helped
him survive the road to godhood, and will help kill other gods in the future.

mobs.LongDesc: A fat man in a big hat is working on something mechanical.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Gond: Lesser Power of Concordant Opposition
   Gond, the Wonderbringer, is the god of craft. He can do with gears
and levers what some gods can't even accomplish with magic. His
goal is to prove that with the right materials, and the right craftsman,
anything can be accomplished without magical aid. He appears to be
a middle-aged man, rather plump,and always wearing a wide-brimmed
sun hat. He is always covered covered in oil, and seems not to mind
getting right down to the dirty work.

mobs.LongDesc: The mage-robed god of wizards seems to ignore your intrusion.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Azuth: Demipower of Arcardia
   Azuth, though a god in his own right, exists to serve Mystra. As God
of Mages, his best interests are nearly identical to hers, and he acts
as one of her Chosen, guarding a portion of his parton's power. He
appears as any human mage would, dressed in splendid robes and
having a studious demeanor.

mobs.LongDesc: An armored guardian blocks the celestial stairway.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Helm: Lesser Power of Nirvana
   Helm is the God of Guardians. During the Time of Troubles, he was
the only god allowed to retain his power. He was ordered by Ao not
to allow anyone past him unless they carried both Tablets of Fate. In
cvarrying out that duty, he was forced to kill his lover, Mystra, yet he
did so hesitation...but much sadness. He is the epitome of the perfect
guardian: strong, brave, and unfailingly follows orders.

mobs.LongDesc: A god dressed in robes the colors of dawn smiles at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lathander: Greater Power of Elysium
   Lathander is the god of renewal, dawn, and springtime. He seems to
always be in a bright mood, and is hopeful about the future. His robes
are the bright reds, yellows and oranges of the first light of dawn.

mobs.LongDesc: If you can see Leira here, something is wrong.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Leira: Demipower of Limbo
   Leira is the godess of deception and illusion. Her powers are so
great that she can even hide herself from the considerable scyring
power of Mystra and Oghma. On a whim, she may hide from the other
gods for years at a time, just to prove that she still can. Any physical
description ofher would be a guess at best, since she is always in
disguise, and can alter her form at will. If she has a true form, she has
kept it secret for aeons.

mobs.LongDesc: Anyone BUT Mask is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Mask: Lesser Power of Hades
   Mask is the God of Deception, and Patron of Thieves. His whole
existance is based on falsification and obfuscation. He keeps his face
hidden behind a loose-fitting black mask. The only features that remain
constant on him are his glowing red eyes, and the small fangs, protruding
from his upper jaw.

mobs.LongDesc: A god wearing drab monk's-robes awaits your request for knowledge.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Oghma: Greater Power of Concordant
   Oghma is the god of knowledge and bardcraft. His library in Concordant
is the senter of knowledge throughout the multiverse. In their afterlife,
his followers spend their time writing down the sum of their knowledge
into the "Great Bard"'s library. Oghma makes all knowledge freely
available to anyone, but asks that they trade any information they might
have, if possible.

mobs.LongDesc: The godess of beauty winks at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Sune: Greater Power of Arvandor
   Sune is the godess of beauty, love, and passion. She is vain and
conceited, and rather irresponsible. She promotes and practices the
chaos of obeying whim over logic, and can cause much trouble. Her
vanity isn't completely baseless however. Suiting the godess of beauty,
she is the most beautiful of beings.

mobs.LongDesc: A man whose garb depicts bolts of lightning glares at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Talos: Greater Power of Pandemonium
   Talos is the god of storms and  destruction. He lives to undo the work
of his rival god, Lathander, who is constantly (and inexplicably, from 
Talos's point of view) creating and renewing. Talos is single-minded in
his wish for the destruction of all things.

mobs.LongDesc: A godly warrior in plate armor prepares for battle.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Tempus: Greater Power of Limbo
   Tempus is the Lord of Battle. He loves war for the sheer joy of it. He
is a master general, and his divine army is divided into two halves, so
that even in times of peace in the outer planes, they can war with one
another. Many warriors live their whole lives in hopes that when they
die, they will earn a commission in Tempus' army. The God of War
himself is always dressed for battle, in impressive armor, and wielding
some sort of huge weapon.

mobs.LongDesc: Torm is here, protecting his divine patron, Tyr.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Torm: Demipower of the Prime Material
   Torm is the god of duty, loyalty and obedience. He is call "the True"
and "the Brave" by his followers. Torm is the ultimate protector of law
and justice, due to his duty to his patron, Tyr, the god of justice. Torm
feels he has a responsibility to each of the gods, though these "chains
of duty" bind him more strongly to lawful and good dieties.
  Torm appears in resplendant armor of a dusky purple hue, with gold
trimmings.

mobs.LongDesc: Some lucky woman is here, gambling at dice...and winning.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Tymora: Lesser Power of Arvandor
   Tymora is godess of skill and good fortune, and is the patron of
adventurers. She is also known as "Lady Luck." Tymora is one fo the
more popular dieties among adventurers who have to frequently rely on
their wits and  pure luck to survive. Tymora favors those who take what
fate gives them and make the best of it.
   Tymora herself has a rather unremarkable appearance, but she can
easily be picked out of a crowd of gamblers...she's the one who never
loses.

mobs.LongDesc: A blindfolded god stands here, holding a scale.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Tyr: Greater Power of the Seven Heavens
   Tyr is the blind, one-handed god of justice. Don't let his infirmity fool
you though, for he is fully capable of carrying out the cause of justice.
He not only has his own divine might to call upon, but he has the power
of his attendant diety, Torm, who will follow any order given to him by
his most-just patron. Tyr is frequently called upon by other dieties to
serve as a judge of a mediator. Even though he may often agree with
the good aligned dieties in principal, he will rule in favor of even an evil
god, if they are in the right, according to the evidence he is presented
with.

mobs.LongDesc: A frost-covered woman is here, staring icily at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Auril: Demipower of Pandemonium
  Auril is the goddess of cold. She is mostly connected with harsh
winters, killing frosts, and blizzards. Few people worship her directly.
Most who invoke her name use it as a curse or out of fear of her influence.

mobs.LongDesc: The overgod ignores you completely.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Ao looks neither old nor young, yet he is infinitely old. He is the 
power that created the gods themselves, and could destroy them on a
whim. If ever you were to attack him, you would most surely die, though
he seems to be rather distracted right now. You can hear him talking
to some other power: "They have restored the Balance, Master. The
Realms are once again secure."
  You wonder what omnipotent power Ao could be calling "Master".

mobs.LongDesc: A tired-looking guys is sitting here, running some sort of game.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This guy is the DM (Dungeon Master) of an AD&D campaign. He is
in charge of everything except the player's characters decisions. If he
decides that the laws of physics aren't working to suit his needs, he
can just go ahead and change em. Now that you've entered his domain,
you too will be subject to his whim. Fortunately he seems preoccupied
with running his campaign. Acting as one on the non-player characters,
you hear him say: "An how does your cosmos fare, Ao?"

mobs.LongDesc: A guy is kneeling on the floor rolling HUGE handfuls of 6-sided dice.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Some people have way too much fun playing mages. This is one of
them. He just loves blowing things up with insanely large fireballs, and
doesn't mind spending 15 minutes counting up the rolls on a few dozen
6-sided dice to find out jsut how much damage his character is doing.

mobs.LongDesc: Some crazy guy is screaming about how he's gonna kill everything.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Some guys just get way to into these "hack and slash" characters.
Humor him and you'll be fine.

mobs.LongDesc: An annoying kid is bartering healing spells for magic items.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Someone should make a rule against immature players who try to
extort magic from their party members. This particular cleric has a very
short life expectancy as it is, since he wants the fighter's plate mail +4.
The fighter is prolly gonna smoosh him soon.

mobs.LongDesc: A quite-looking guy is sitting at the table not doing much.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Occasionally you get one like this. He just sits there and lets everyone
else do everything. He's too quiet to be heard over the other rowdies
playing, and doesn't seem very creative. Maybe he just doesn't like to
play. Or maybe it's that he's scared to death of that psychotic fighter's
player.

mobs.LongDesc: a lost caravan guard is looking for help
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This man look really scared. You're not quite sure what he's seen,
but you hope that you don't see it. He's too incoherent to be of any help
telling you what is out there that has scared him so much.

mobs.LongDesc: A desert nomad looks at you fearfully.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The nomads who make Anauroch their home area superstitious people
who are wary of outsiders and magic. They would not kill someone 
outright, though, but being left in the desert without their hospitality is
almost assuredly a death sentence. This is not an environment where
the wear survive.

mobs.LongDesc: A cloaked figure with huge eyes and disembodied hands watches you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The seneschal of Bone Castle is an ultraloth who is completely loyal
to whomever is the current resident of the Castle (i.e. the present God
of Death). Presently, it is in the servitude of Cyric, and serves him
by keeping order in the City of Strife, and recording the fates assigned
to the damned.

mobs.LongDesc: An ancient knight is here to guard the exit to the mortal realms.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
In life, Alban Onire was a paladin of Torm, and a great foe of the evil
giants. In death, he guards the exit to the mortal world, so that the souls
of the dead do not wreak havok among the living. The orders given to
him by Torm were quite specific about letting people through this portal.
Getting the key from him may not prove to be the easiest of tasks.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge, golem-like construction stands here, impassively.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Maruts are the servants of greater gods, and will do anything in their
service. Unlike the golems that they ressemble, maruts are highly
intelligent and thoughtful. However, their complete neutrality allows them
to serve and god well, since they do not disagree with any order. A
marut will perform its assigned task tirelessly and without distraction
whenever possible, but will enter combat if absolutely necessary.

mobs.LongDesc: TEST MOB SHOULD NOT BE IN THE GAME
A woman dressed in a glowing white gown of magic floats before you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Mystra: Greater Power of Nirvana
  Mystra is the most powerful of all the gods of Toril. She reigns as
supreme ruler of all magic on a world that is dominated magic. She is
also one of two gods that was granted immortality after the Time of 
Troubles. In her mortal life she retrieved the Tablets of Fate, which then
allowed the gods to regain their rightful positions in the heavens, after
the overgod Ao had cast them out. She has knowledge of every spell
ever cast by any mage or cleric throughout all of history, and can cast
any of them at will. Her power is so great that she is not permitted to
retain it all herself, and thus stores much of it in her Chosen. If not for
this precaution, she would easily be a match for the overgod himself.
